abstract.text: A protocol that provides advance warning of the data requirements for a collection view, allowing the triggering of asynchronous data load operations.

inlineContent.text: You use a prefetch data source object in conjunction with your collection view’s data source to begin loading data for cells before the
data source method is called.
Follow these steps to add a prefetch data source to your collection view:
Create the collection view and its data source.
Create an object that adopts the
protocol, and assign it to the
property on the collection view.
Initiate asynchronous loading of the data required for the cells at the specified index paths in your implementation of
Prepare the cell for display using the prefetched data in your implementation of the
data source method.
Cancel pending data load operations when the collection view informs you that the data is no longer required in the
method.
The prefetch method isn’t necessarily called for every cell in the collection view. See
for details on a suggested approach to loading data.
For more information, see
The
method isn’t necessarily called for every cell in the collection view. Your implementation of
must therefore be able to cope with the following potential situations:
Data has been loaded via the prefetch request, and is ready to be displayed.
Data is currently being prefetched, but isn’t yet available.
Data hasn’t yet been requested.
One approach that handles all of these situations is to use
to load the data for each row. You create the

object and store it in the prefetch method. The data source method can then either retrieve the operation and the result, or create it if it doesn’t exist. For further information about how you can use asynchronous programming models to achieve this desired behavior, see

abstract.text: An abstract class that represents the code and data associated with a single task.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A representation of the state of the data in a layout section at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a layout section at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a view at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a view at a specific point in time.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
The object that acts as the prefetching data source for the collection view, receiving notifications of upcoming cell data requirements.
The methods adopted by the object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
Asks your data source object for the cell that corresponds to the specified item in the collection view.
A protocol that provides advance warning of the data requirements for a collection view, allowing the triggering of asynchronous data load operations.
Cancels a previously triggered data prefetch request.
Tells your prefetch data source object to begin preparing data for the cells at the supplied index paths.
The object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
The object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
A standard control that can initiate the refreshing of a scroll view’s contents.
Improve the performance of lists and collections in your app with prefetching and image preparation.

abstract.text: Bring compositional layouts to your app and simplify updating your user interface with diffable data sources.
Load data for collection view cells before they display.
Streamline the display and update of data in a collection view using a diffable data source that contains identifiers.

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
